Hi Everyone, While I am happy to order consumables such as coffee, tea, soda, snacks on a regular basis - I only order from Instacart every few weeks.
let's be sure to get half and half every time then
maybe two cartons is appropriate given consumption patterns
also, I still stand by my separate facilities-request channel if that is the restocking interval: it will make generating the shopping list much easier since there should be less noise

as it is people request things multiple times to no avail I assume because things get lost in the noise
maybe slack is the wrong venue? do we need a whiteboard list?
if you don't want to make a separate channel then it seems like it will just be the status quo

there are different facets here, but regardless of how perfect we make a request/wish/alert process, the fact remains we're a small company with a busy staff, and followup may be delayed for multiple reasons. i think the process of request/list could be tightened a little, but the rubber meets the road where someone, usually Stephanie, follows up. we are contemplating what some additional support staff could afford us to raise the consistency and standard of responsiveness, within the parameters of what is fair the company to be providing, and in the meantime, it'd be great if people are patient, tolerant, and willing to fill gaps.
tldr; changing request process won't bring your half and half much faster

to be clean, this isn't just about the half and half

Would it make sense to share the responsibility of tracking what we need every week? Maybe we could volunteer and rotate each week.
guys wouldnt a physical list address the issue at hand?
I always feel super guilty (and a bit entitled) when I complain that we’re about to run out of coffee. Would love to help a bit more.
need it? write it down
switching gears from my attempt to give some context - we used to have a shopping list Trello board - helpful if you're checking while at the store. not updated/maintained, of course.
we could link Trello to this channel so that requests get put on the list, and when they're updated, then the channel hears about that as well.
